title: Enhancing Neural Network Generalization with Dropout Techniques
summary: This study investigates the effect of dropout regularization on the generalization capability of deep neural networks. By randomly deactivating neurons during training, dropout prevents overfitting and encourages the network to learn robust features. The experiments were conducted on several benchmark datasets, including MNIST and CIFAR-10, comparing models with and without dropout layers. Results demonstrate a significant improvement in accuracy and reduced variance across multiple runs. Additionally, we explore the impact of different dropout rates and configurations, providing guidelines for selecting optimal parameters for various architectures. The study concludes that dropout is an effective and computationally inexpensive method for enhancing neural network performance, especially in scenarios with limited training data.
category: Machine Learning

title: Transfer Learning Approaches for Medical Image Classification
summary: In this research, we examine the application of transfer learning for classifying medical images. Pretrained convolutional neural networks (CNNs) were fine-tuned on domain-specific datasets, including chest X-rays and histopathology images. The study compares several architectures, including ResNet50, DenseNet121, and EfficientNet, evaluating their performance using metrics such as accuracy, F1-score, and AUC. Our results indicate that transfer learning significantly reduces training time and improves classification performance compared to training networks from scratch. Moreover, we explore the influence of data augmentation and layer freezing strategies. The findings suggest that transfer learning is a promising approach for developing accurate and efficient medical image classifiers, even with limited labeled datasets.
category: Machine Learning

title: Optimizing Hyperparameters in Gradient Boosting Models Using Bayesian Methods
summary: Hyperparameter tuning is crucial for the performance of gradient boosting models such as XGBoost and LightGBM. This paper investigates the use of Bayesian optimization techniques to systematically select hyperparameters, including learning rate, max depth, and number of estimators. Experiments on regression and classification datasets demonstrate that Bayesian optimization outperforms grid search and random search in terms of accuracy and convergence speed. Additionally, the paper discusses the trade-offs between exploration and exploitation in the optimization process and provides practical guidelines for implementing Bayesian tuning in real-world machine learning pipelines. Overall, the method enhances model robustness and predictive performance while reducing computational cost.
category: Machine Learning

title: Reinforcement Learning for Autonomous Drone Navigation
summary: This research explores the application of reinforcement learning (RL) algorithms for autonomous drone navigation in complex environments. The study employs Deep Q-Networks (DQN) and Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO) to train drones to navigate obstacle-laden paths using simulated environments. Performance is evaluated based on navigation accuracy, collision avoidance, and training convergence. Results indicate that PPO outperforms DQN in terms of stability and adaptability to dynamic environments. Additionally, the paper investigates the effect of reward shaping and state representation on learning efficiency. The findings highlight the potential of RL-based methods for enabling autonomous drones to perform tasks in real-world scenarios, including delivery, surveillance, and search-and-rescue operations.
category: Machine Learning

title: Explainable AI in Predictive Maintenance for Industrial Equipment
summary: The adoption of predictive maintenance strategies in industry relies heavily on machine learning models capable of forecasting equipment failures. This study focuses on the integration of explainable AI (XAI) techniques with predictive models to enhance interpretability and trustworthiness. Gradient boosting and recurrent neural networks were trained on sensor data collected from industrial machines. SHAP (Shapley Additive Explanations) values were used to analyze feature importance and understand model decisions. Results demonstrate that XAI methods provide valuable insights into failure patterns and improve human operators’ confidence in automated predictions. The research emphasizes that combining predictive accuracy with interpretability is crucial for practical deployment of AI-driven maintenance systems in industrial settings.
category: Machine Learning

title: Graph Neural Networks for Social Network Analysis
summary: This study investigates the use of graph neural networks (GNNs) for analyzing social networks. By representing users and their interactions as nodes and edges, GNNs capture complex relational structures that traditional methods often miss. Experiments on datasets such as Facebook and Twitter show that GNNs improve node classification and link prediction tasks compared to baseline models. We also explore different GNN architectures, including Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs) and Graph Attention Networks (GATs), analyzing their effectiveness in large-scale networks. The research highlights the potential of GNNs in understanding social dynamics, detecting communities, and predicting influence patterns.
category: Machine Learning

title: Federated Learning for Privacy-Preserving Healthcare Applications
summary: This paper explores federated learning (FL) for training machine learning models across distributed healthcare datasets while maintaining patient privacy. Hospitals collaboratively train models without sharing raw data, reducing privacy risks and complying with regulations. Experiments on medical imaging datasets demonstrate that FL achieves comparable performance to centralized training. We also discuss challenges such as communication efficiency, model aggregation, and dealing with heterogeneous data. Results indicate that FL is a viable solution for building robust, privacy-preserving healthcare AI systems, enabling cross-institution collaboration without compromising sensitive information.
category: Machine Learning

title: AutoML for Efficient Model Selection in Machine Learning Pipelines
summary: Automated machine learning (AutoML) aims to streamline the model selection and hyperparameter tuning process. This study evaluates popular AutoML frameworks, including Auto-sklearn, TPOT, and H2O AutoML, on classification and regression tasks. The paper compares model accuracy, training time, and resource utilization. Results show that AutoML frameworks significantly reduce manual effort while maintaining competitive performance. Furthermore, we analyze the impact of feature preprocessing, ensemble techniques, and search strategies within AutoML pipelines. The findings suggest that AutoML is an effective tool for both novice and experienced practitioners seeking optimized machine learning solutions.
category: Machine Learning

title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Time Series Forecasting
summary: Time series forecasting is critical in fields such as finance, energy, and weather prediction. This research applies convolutional neural networks (CNNs) to capture temporal patterns in multivariate time series data. Several CNN architectures were tested and compared with traditional models such as ARIMA and LSTM networks. Experiments show that CNNs outperform baseline methods in terms of forecast accuracy and computational efficiency. We also investigate kernel size, depth, and pooling strategies to optimize model performance. The study demonstrates the suitability of CNNs for scalable and accurate time series prediction applications.
category: Machine Learning

title: Adversarial Attacks and Defenses in Deep Learning Systems
summary: Deep learning systems are vulnerable to adversarial attacks, where small perturbations in input data can lead to incorrect predictions. This study examines various attack strategies, including FGSM, PGD, and CW methods, on image classification models. We also evaluate defense mechanisms such as adversarial training, defensive distillation, and input preprocessing. Experimental results indicate that while some defenses improve robustness, there is no universal solution. The research highlights the importance of developing resilient models, understanding attack vectors, and incorporating security considerations in deep learning pipelines.
category: Machine Learning

title: Reinforcement Learning for Autonomous Drone Navigation
summary: This paper explores reinforcement learning (RL) techniques for autonomous drone navigation in dynamic environments. Using simulated and real-world scenarios, we train RL agents to optimize path planning, obstacle avoidance, and energy efficiency. The study compares value-based and policy-based RL algorithms, including DQN and PPO, assessing performance on metrics such as collision rate, trajectory smoothness, and learning speed. Results demonstrate that RL agents can effectively learn navigation strategies without human supervision. Additionally, the research highlights the potential for RL to improve autonomous drone applications in delivery, surveillance, and environmental monitoring.
category: Machine Learning

title: Explainable AI for Financial Risk Assessment
summary: Financial institutions require transparent and interpretable AI models for risk assessment. This study applies explainable AI (XAI) techniques, including SHAP, LIME, and counterfactual explanations, to credit scoring and loan approval datasets. The paper analyzes the trade-off between model accuracy and interpretability, demonstrating that XAI methods help identify key risk factors, detect biases, and enhance regulatory compliance. Experiments show that interpretable models can maintain high performance while providing actionable insights for stakeholders. The findings emphasize the importance of explainability in high-stakes AI applications.
category: Machine Learning

title: Transfer Learning in Natural Language Processing
summary: Transfer learning has become a standard approach in NLP, allowing pre-trained language models to adapt to specific tasks with limited data. This research evaluates the effectiveness of models such as BERT, GPT-2, and RoBERTa on tasks including sentiment analysis, question answering, and named entity recognition. Fine-tuning strategies, data augmentation techniques, and domain adaptation methods are discussed. Experiments reveal that transfer learning significantly reduces training time and improves performance compared to training models from scratch. The study provides guidelines for practitioners to select and adapt pre-trained NLP models efficiently.
category: Machine Learning

title: Unsupervised Anomaly Detection Using Autoencoders
summary: Anomaly detection is critical in applications such as fraud detection, network security, and industrial monitoring. This study applies unsupervised learning using autoencoders to detect anomalies in high-dimensional datasets. By reconstructing normal patterns and measuring reconstruction error, the models can identify outliers effectively. Variants including denoising autoencoders and variational autoencoders are evaluated on benchmark datasets. Results show that autoencoder-based approaches outperform traditional statistical methods, offering scalable solutions for real-time anomaly detection in complex systems.
category: Machine Learning

title: Hybrid Machine Learning Models for Predictive Maintenance
summary: Predictive maintenance aims to forecast equipment failures and optimize maintenance schedules. This research investigates hybrid models combining machine learning algorithms, such as random forests, gradient boosting, and neural networks, with domain knowledge from sensor data. Experiments on industrial machinery datasets show that hybrid models improve prediction accuracy and reduce false alarms. The study also examines feature engineering, sensor fusion, and temporal data handling. The findings support the adoption of hybrid ML approaches to enhance operational efficiency and reduce downtime in manufacturing and industrial environments.
category: Machine Learning

title: Deep Learning for Medical Image Segmentation
summary: This study explores deep convolutional neural networks for segmenting medical images such as MRI and CT scans. Various architectures including U-Net, SegNet, and DeepLabv3+ are evaluated. Experiments on multiple datasets show that deep learning approaches achieve high segmentation accuracy and can assist radiologists in detecting tumors, lesions, and other abnormalities. Data augmentation, transfer learning, and attention mechanisms are employed to improve performance.
category: Machine Learning

title: Graph Neural Networks for Social Network Analysis
summary: Graph neural networks (GNNs) are applied to social network data to predict community structures, link formations, and user behavior. The study compares GCN, GraphSAGE, and GAT models, highlighting their strengths in capturing node features and topological information. Experiments show that GNNs outperform traditional graph algorithms in tasks like friend recommendation, information diffusion prediction, and anomaly detection in networks.
category: Machine Learning

title: Time Series Forecasting with LSTM Networks
summary: This paper investigates the use of Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks for forecasting time series data in domains such as finance, energy, and weather prediction. LSTM models are compared with ARIMA and Prophet models, demonstrating superior performance in capturing long-term dependencies and non-linear patterns. Hyperparameter tuning and input feature engineering significantly enhance model accuracy. The results suggest that deep learning approaches are effective for complex sequential data.
category: Machine Learning

title: AI-Powered Cybersecurity Threat Detection
summary: Cybersecurity systems increasingly rely on machine learning for threat detection. This research applies supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, including random forests, SVMs, and autoencoders, to identify malware, phishing attacks, and network intrusions. Feature selection, anomaly scoring, and ensemble methods are explored. Results indicate that AI-powered models can detect threats faster and more accurately than traditional signature-based systems, contributing to proactive security management.
category: Machine Learning

title: Federated Learning for Privacy-Preserving AI
summary: Federated learning enables multiple devices to collaboratively train models without sharing raw data, enhancing privacy. This study examines federated learning frameworks for mobile and IoT applications, analyzing communication efficiency, model convergence, and robustness against adversarial attacks. Experiments show that federated approaches maintain high predictive performance while protecting sensitive data, highlighting the potential of distributed ML for healthcare, finance, and personalized services.
category: Machine Learning

title: Reinforcement Learning for Autonomous Driving
summary: This research applies reinforcement learning algorithms to autonomous vehicle control in simulated urban environments. Policy gradient methods and deep Q-networks are implemented to optimize navigation, collision avoidance, and traffic compliance. Experiments show that RL agents learn efficient driving strategies, adapting to dynamic traffic scenarios and reducing accidents. The study highlights the potential of RL for real-world self-driving applications.
category: Machine Learning

title: Transformer Models for Natural Language Understanding
summary: Transformer-based architectures such as BERT, RoBERTa, and GPT are explored for various NLP tasks including sentiment analysis, question answering, and text summarization. The study evaluates pre-training, fine-tuning strategies, and attention mechanisms, demonstrating superior performance compared to traditional RNN-based models. Results indicate transformers’ capability in capturing long-range dependencies and contextual information effectively.
category: Machine Learning

title: Anomaly Detection in IoT Networks Using Machine Learning
summary: This paper investigates ML techniques for detecting anomalies in IoT networks, focusing on abnormal traffic patterns and device behavior. Supervised, unsupervised, and semi-supervised models, including isolation forests and autoencoders, are evaluated. Experiments show high detection accuracy with low false positive rates, suggesting that ML approaches can improve IoT security and network reliability.
category: Machine Learning

title: Image Super-Resolution with Convolutional Neural Networks
summary: The study presents CNN-based models for enhancing the resolution of low-quality images in fields such as satellite imagery, medical imaging, and photography. Various architectures are tested, including SRCNN and residual networks. Results demonstrate that deep learning techniques significantly improve visual quality and structural details, outperforming classical interpolation methods.
category: Machine Learning

title: Explainable AI for Financial Decision-Making
summary: Explainable AI (XAI) techniques are applied to machine learning models in finance, aiming to improve interpretability of credit scoring, risk assessment, and trading predictions. Methods such as SHAP, LIME, and counterfactual explanations are evaluated. Findings show that XAI enhances trust and transparency in AI-driven financial decisions, allowing stakeholders to understand model reasoning and mitigate risks.
category: Machine Learning

title: Speech Recognition Using Deep Neural Networks
summary: Deep neural networks are applied to automatic speech recognition tasks, including transcription and speaker identification. Convolutional and recurrent architectures are combined to process acoustic features and temporal dependencies. Experiments show high word accuracy rates on benchmark datasets and robustness to background noise. The study demonstrates DNNs’ potential for real-time speech applications.
category: Machine Learning

title: Generative Adversarial Networks for Art and Design
summary: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) are employed to create artistic images and design patterns. Various GAN architectures, including DCGAN and StyleGAN, are explored. Results indicate that GANs can generate realistic and novel art, providing tools for creative industries and computational design. Evaluation metrics and human perceptual studies confirm visual quality and diversity.
category: Machine Learning

title: Machine Learning for Predictive Maintenance
summary: Predictive maintenance strategies are enhanced using ML algorithms to predict equipment failure and optimize maintenance schedules. Techniques such as random forests, gradient boosting, and neural networks are applied to sensor data from industrial machines. Experiments demonstrate reduced downtime and maintenance costs, proving the efficacy of ML in industrial operations.
category: Machine Learning

title: Computer Vision for Agricultural Monitoring
summary: This study applies computer vision and ML techniques to monitor crop health, detect pests, and estimate yields. Convolutional neural networks and image segmentation models process aerial and ground images. Results show high accuracy in detecting plant stress and diseases, offering solutions for precision agriculture and sustainable farming practices.
category: Machine Learning

title: Optimization of Hyperparameters in Deep Learning
summary: Hyperparameter optimization methods, including grid search, random search, and Bayesian optimization, are applied to deep learning models. The study evaluates their impact on model performance, training time, and generalization. Experiments on multiple datasets demonstrate that proper hyperparameter tuning significantly enhances accuracy and efficiency, emphasizing the importance of automated ML pipelines.
category: Machine Learning

title: "title": "Karar Ağaçları ve Rastgele Orman (Random Forest) Algoritmalarının Temel Farkları"

"summary": "Karar Ağaçlarının yapısal mantığını (Entropy ve Gini Katsayısı ile bilgi kazancı) inceleyen ve bu tek ağacın aşırı uydurma eğilimini açıklayan akademik bir çalışma. Rastgele Ormanlar'ın (Random Forest) ise 'topluluk öğrenme' (Ensemble Learning) prensibiyle birden fazla ağacı birleştirerek bu aşırı uydurma sorununu nasıl çözdüğünü ve tahmin gücünü nasıl artırdığını matematiksel olarak analiz etmektedir."

"summary": "Derin Sinir Ağlarının eğitiminin temelini oluşturan Geri Yayılım (Backpropagation) algoritmasını popüler ve anlaşılır bir dille açıklayan makale. Zincir Kuralı (Chain Rule) kullanılarak hata (loss) sinyalinin ağın katmanları boyunca nasıl geriye doğru iletildiği ve her ağırlığın (weight) bu sinyale göre nasıl güncellendiği basitleştirilmiş bir şekilde anlatılmıştır."

Zekanın insan kontrolünden çıkması durumunda oluşabilecek potansiyel tehlikeler (Kontrol Sorunu) ve bu riskleri en aza indirmek için şimdiden alınması gereken tasarım ve yönetim prensipleri tartışılmıştır."

"title": "Python'da Model Seçimi: AIC ve BIC Kriterlerinin Uygulanması"

Bu kriterlerin model karmaşıklığı ile modelin verilere uyumu arasındaki ödünleşimi nasıl ölçtüğü ve Python'da nasıl hesaplanacağı kod bloklarıyla açıklanmıştır."

category: sıcaklık) özellik çıkarmanın ve zaman serisi sınıflandırma algoritmalarının rolü basitleştirilmiştir."

Turing Testi'ni geçen bir sistemin bile sadece simülasyon yapabileceği ve gerçek bir bilinç veya öznel deneyime sahip olmayabileceği yönündeki (Çin Odası Argümanı gibi) eleştiriler ele alınmıştır."
"title": "Ağaç Tabanlı Modellerde Özellik Önem Derecesi (Feature Importance) Hesaplama Metodları"
"summary": "Karar Ağaçları

category: hangi özelliklerin tahmin üzerinde en büyük etkiye sahip olduğunu belirlemeye yarayan **Özellik Önem Derecesi** (Feature Importance) metriklerini inceleyen akademik bir makale. **Gini Katsayısı** veya **Entropy** ile ölçülen bilgi kazancı (information gain) tabanlı önem hesaplamaları ile Permütasyon Temelli Önem (Permutation Importance) yaklaşımlarının matematiksel temelleri karşılaştırılmıştır."

summary: müşteri davranış verilerini (satın alma sıklığı

title: "title": "Derin Öğrenmede Batch Normalizasyon (Batch Normalization) ve İç Kovaryat Kayması"

"summary": "Derin Sinir Ağlarının eğitimini hızlandırmak ve modelin yakınsamasını (convergence) stabilize etmek için kullanılan **Batch Normalizasyon** (BN) tekniğini inceleyen akademik bir makale. BN'nin her katmanın girdilerini normalize ederek **İç Kovaryat Kayması** (Internal Covariate Shift) problemini nasıl azalttığı ve modelin öğrenme hızını nasıl artırdığı analiz edilmiştir."

title: "title": "Python'da Scikit-learn ile Hiperparametre Optimizasyonu: Random ve Grid Search"

summary: her bir sınıfa ait olma olasılığını hesaplamak için kullanılan ve olasılıkların toplamını bire eşitleyen **Softmax Aktivasyon Fonksiyonunun** formülasyonu analiz edilmiştir."

"summary": "Yapay Zeka modellerinin

Bu saldırıların otonom araçlar ve tıbbi teşhis sistemleri üzerindeki potansiyel yıkıcı etkileri ve savunma mekanizmalarının gerekliliği ele alınmıştır."

title: "title": "Python'da Gelişmiş Özellik Ölçekleme (Scaling): Robust ve Quantile Scaler"

"title": "Destek Vektör Makineleri (SVM) için Doğrusal Olmayan (Non-linear) Sınıflandırma"

Doğrusal olmayan bir uzaya haritalama yapan **Kernel Trick**'in (Çekirdek Hilesi) matematiksel mekanizması ve **RBF (Radyal Tabanlı Fonksiyon)** gibi çekirdeklerin rolü analiz edilmiştir."

summary: azınlık sınıfı hatalarını daha ağır cezalandırma prensibi analiz edilmiştir."

RBM'lerin katman katman eğitilerek nasıl **Derin İnanç Ağlarını** (Deep Belief Networks - DBN) oluşturduğu ve özellik öğrenimindeki rolü analiz edilmiştir."

summary: **Lasso** ($$L_1$$) ve **Ridge** ($$L_2$$) düzenlileştirmelerinin karışımı olarak nasıl hem özellik seçimi yaptığı hem de çoklu doğrusallık sorununu nasıl hafiflettiği analiz edilmiştir."

title: "title": "Python'da NLP: Metin Sınıflandırma için Hiperparametre Optimizasyonu (Grid Search)"

Tüm olası hiperparametre kombinasyonlarını sistematik olarak deneyen **Grid Search** (Izgara Araması) yönteminin Python'da Sklearn ile nasıl uygulanacağı kod bloklarıyla detaylandırılmıştır."

title: "title": "Yapay Zeka Etiği: Modelin Kötü Niyetli Kullanımı (Adversarial Attacks) ve Savunma"

summary: algılanamaz ufak değişiklikler (gürültü) içeren **Kötü Niyetli Saldırıların** (Adversarial Attacks) etik ve güvenlik zorluklarını inceleyen bir tartışma. Bu tür saldırılara karşı **Model Savunması** (Adversarial Defense) için kullanılan teknikler ele alınmıştır."

title: "title": "Doğal Dil İşlemede Dikkat Mekanizması: Çapraz Dikkat (Cross-Attention) ve Encoder-Decoder"

"summary": "Transformatör tabanlı modellerde (örneğin çeviri) kullanılan ve iki farklı dizinin (örneğin kaynak cümle ve hedef cümle) etkileşimini sağlayan **Çapraz Dikkat** (Cross-Attention) mekanizmasının matematiksel prensibini inceleyen akademik bir makale. **Encoder**'ın çıktısını **Decoder**'ın girdisiyle ilişkilendirerek çeviri gibi görevlerde modelin performansını nasıl artırdığı analiz edilmiştir."

title: "title": "Destek Vektör Makinelerinde (SVM) Yumuşak Marj (Soft Margin) ve Cezalandırma Parametresi (C)"

Sınıflandırma hatalarına izin verme miktarını kontrol eden **Cezalandırma Parametresinin** ($C$) matematiksel rolü ve bu parametrenin yanlılık-varyans (bias-variance) dengesi üzerindeki etkisi analiz edilmiştir."

summary: hata terimlerinin sıfır ortalama
